notes: Title 'The First Betrayal' is key—not just Marcus betraying Nico, but Nico betraying his own values by becoming pragmatic power-broker. The theft forces impossible choice: save dying child or protect organization. Nico chooses compassion (pays 500k) but staff sees weakness. Kade's argument: fear + love = lasting power, love alone = vulnerability. Marcus's justification is valid—Nico's triage left him behind, so he took what he needed. Systemic critique: when resources are limited, someone always suffers. Nico can't be both compassionate leader and effective administrator. His return to Veil (2 vials) shows stress overwhelming his coping. Arc 0.58—past midpoint, facing failure. The chapter shows charity's limitation: you can't scale compassion because it creates exploitable patterns. Wei catching theft shows she's competent, but also shows system is vulnerable. Nico's final realization: he's probably already failing, doesn't know how to stop. Sets up need for systematic solutions (cooperatives) in ch19.
